intro: Hibbertia oxycraspedota, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia oxycraspedota is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
